revised_title: Photolysis of Polymethylvinylketone: Reactions and Kinetics
tldr: The photolysis of polymethylvinylketone in solution has been studied, revealing two primary reactions similar to those in simple aliphatic ketones. The degradation of the polymer results in molecular weight changes, which are followed by viscosity, osmotic pressure, and ultracentrifuge measurements. The photochemistry of aldehydes and ketones has been extensively studied, and this research contributes to understanding the photodegradation of polymers and their properties.
